'Bloomsbury Publishing plc' () is an independent, worldwide publishing house of
fiction and non-fiction with its headquarters in the London Borough of Camden,
and publishing offices in London, New York and Sydney. It is a constituent of
the FTSE SmallCap Index. The company's growth over the past decade is primarily
attributable to the [[Harry Potter]] series by J. K. Rowling. Bloomsbury was
named Publisher of the Year in 1999 and 2000 by the British book industry. It
published [[The Finkler Question]] by Howard Jacobson, which won the 2010 Man
Booker Prize.
